Package com.tregouet.context_interpreter.data_types

This package contains the input and output data types of the context interpreter.

See: Description

Package com.tregouet.context_interpreter.data_types Description

This package contains the input and output data types of the context interpreter.

A context interpreter accepts contexts ((IContext) as inputs, i.e. sets of objects. Each object (IContextObject) is "dumbly" described in a context-blind fashion, by a set of constructs (IConstruct) such as "words" generated by a context-free grammar. This raw description takes no account of the context that objects are part of ; nor do the similarities that can exists between objects influence the way they are characterized.

A context interpreter outputs representations (IRepresentation). These data structures are based on ad hoc categories extracted from the context. Representations allow the description of objects in a context-sensitive manner, as well as measures of similarity between objects and production of inferences. Representations are also associated with a cost ; thus, not only can a context interpreter generate alternative representations of a given context, but it can also make predictions about which of theses acceptable representations will be considered as optimal.

Author:
Gael Tregouet
